title: Patient-Level Value Analysis in Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: An Analysis of Time-Driven Activity-Based Costs and Symptom Improvement in 2,789 Procedures.
abstract: Value in health care is defined as optimized patient-centered outcomes and streamlined costs of care. A patient-level value analysis (PLVA) is a novel value-based health care research method. In a PLVA, the ratio of outcomes to cost is calculated for each individual patient in a cohort, and factors that optimize value are investigated. We performed a PLVA in primary total knee arthroplasty (TKA). We conducted a retrospective analysis of a prospectively maintained multi-institutional arthroplasty registry. A total of 2,789 primary manual TKAs were analyzed. Knee Osteoarthritis Outcome Score-Physical Function Short-Form (KOOS-PS) scores and costs of care using time-driven activity-based costing (TDABC) were collected.
